p: Samples of suspected cases must be collected with PPE and safe handled adhering to BSL-3 precautions. Specimens must be labelled, packaged in accordance with the guidelines for the transport of dangerous biological goods (triple packaging), stored at 4 °C and addressed to a reference center. If necessary, whole-blood specimens can be dried on blotting paper, stored 30–60 days and transported without refrigeration for retrospective diagnosis confirmation [ 9].
